node.title: Spotify Removes 150 Hours of Podcasts Containing Holocaust Denial, Far Right Conspiracies
node.description: Spotify removed episodes promoting white supremacy and readings of essays and books by Adolf Hitler and Joseph Goebbels.

node.title: Internet Backs Man for Encouraging Sister to Leave Husband, End Pregnancy in Viral Post
node.description: "Two words: Abusive husband. You did her a favor," " wrote one reader in a highly-voted comment.

node.title: Trump attorneys argue for dismissal of E. Jean Carroll's lawsuit
node.description: Carroll is suing Trump over his claim she was "totally lying" about her allegation that he assaulted her in the 1990s to sell a memoir.

node.title: Kiki for a Cause
node.description: The Hetrick-Martin Institute hosts the Emery Awards Ball. Plus, UNICEF turns 75 and Citymeals on Wheels holds a benefit luncheon.

node.title: Kodi Smit-McPhee on Quiet Confidence, Chronic Pain and ‘The Power of the Dog’
node.description: The 25-year-old Aussie delivers a scene-stealing performance as Peter, a bookish boy and aspiring doctor who’s more than he seems.

node.title: Ansel Elgort and Offset Party During Art Basel
node.description: Also, Gucci held a book signing for Mickalene Thomas and Jordan Barrett has a birthday dinner.

node.title: The Demise of the Old Lady
node.description: Juventus has thought for too long about the now, and too little about what comes next.

node.title: U.S. health officials project resolve in fighting the Omicron variant.
node.description: After the first case of an Omicron infection was detected in the U.S., the country saw the highest daily total of vaccine shots since May, though the reporting could be skewed by holiday reporting lags.

node.title: Cat Found at Nashville Airport Mysteriously Microchipped to Italy, Internet on the Case
node.description: Though an animal may be microchipped, a pet owner must register the chip with the microchip company.

node.title: Biden Blames Cold on His Grandson, White House Doctor Says President Negative for COVID
node.description: Kevin O'Connor, Biden's longtime physician, said Friday that Biden will receive over-the-counter medications to help alleviate symptoms.

node.title: 'This is the new normal': Whanganui gets used to life in red zone
node.description: Despite having no active cases of Covid-19 in the community Whanganui woke to find itself in the red zone today.

node.title: Biden signs short-term funding bill to avert government shutdown
node.description: The bill funds the government through February 18, and includes $7 billion to help resettle Afghan refugees.

node.title: Google delays January return to office date
node.description: The Omicron variant is derailing companies' plans to bring workers back to offices.

node.title: 5 Minutes to Make You Love Classical Music
node.description: What are the five minutes you’d play to make a friend fall in love with classical music? That’s what we’ve been asking artists and other notable people all year.

node.title: Young Girl Who Was Sold to 'Old Man' for $2,200 in Afghanistan Rescued and Relocated
node.description: Parwana Malik was sold by her father in October after he couldn't afford food for the rest of the family.

node.title: Pope Francis Says Western Countries Should Accept Migrants As Vatican Takes Some In
node.description: As Pope Francis visited Cyprus, a country overwhelmed by asylum-seekers, the Vatican announced they would take in 12 migrants.

node.title: Woman Claims Her Dog Became Sick After Eating Popular Dog Food Brand in Viral Video
node.description: "We normally don't get this brand, but we were at Target and we needed dog food, so we grabbed it," the TikToker said.

node.title: Teen Admits He Made Threat Against School to Get Day Off After Oxford Shooting: Police
node.description: Police said the suspect "stated that he saw all the other areas schools were closed due to threats and he just wanted a day off of school."

node.title: Man Serving 48 Years for Killing Woman Wants Conviction Tossed After Pandemic Delays Trial
node.description: Carine Reeves claims that because his trial didn't take place within 120 days after he returned to Maine from New York, his guilty verdict should be thrown out.

node.title: Covid-19: Nelson outbreak sees spike in vaccinations
node.description: The Covid-19 outbreak in Nelson seems to have given people the nudge they needed to get their first vaccination.

node.title: Our Most Popular Recipes of 2021
node.description: A countdown of the delicious dishes our readers viewed the most this year.

node.title: Omicron and Travel: So, Now Do I Need Trip Insurance?
node.description: In light of the new variant, is extra protection warranted for things like flight and lodging cancellations and quarantine hotels? It depends. Here’s what you need to know.

node.title: Ethan Crumbley's Parents 'Resisted the Idea' of Pulling Him From School Before Shooting
node.description: The Oakland County Prosecutor said drawings found on Crumbley's desk contained a semi-automatic handgun pointing at the words "the thoughts won't stop help me."

node.title: Union Workers in Rhode Island to Get $3K COVID Vaccine Bonus, Even If Granted Exemption
node.description: Council 94 of the American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees union voted 1,963 to 97 to approve a new contact with the state.

node.title: Since Oxford Shooting, At Least 519 Schools Have Closed Nationwide Due to Threats
node.description: An analysis by Newsweek found that 519 schools closed on Friday as string of copycat threats of violence were made in seven different states.

node.title: Covid-19 wrap: Auckland lockdown ends, traffic light system comes in
node.description: The new traffic light system for managing Covid-19 came in today with Auckland going into the red setting and the city reopening after more than 100 days in lockdown.

node.title: Austrian doctor fined for amputating wrong leg
node.description: The mistake was discovered two days later, during a routine bandage change.

node.title: Behind Low Vaccination Rates Lurks a More Profound Social Weakness
node.description: Vaccine hesitancy reflects a transformation of people’s core beliefs about what we owe each other.

node.title: Lebanese Minister Who Criticized War in Yemen Resigns Under Saudi Pressure
node.description: Comments by the information minister, before he joined the government, prompted a diplomatic rift between Lebanon and powerful Gulf States. It was unclear if his resignation would end the crisis.

node.title: Biden Says U.S. Initiatives Will Make It 'Very, Very Difficult' for Russia to Invade Ukraine
node.description: Biden did not indicate what those initiatives may entail, but Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov said the U.S. has threatened new sanctions against Russia.
